Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage
Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael P Stith

records.addlTxt: Email correspondence with parties. Attorney Lebell's office filed written submission with the court. Case re-scheduled for a status conference date on 12/01/2022 at 08:30 am, Br 16.
Received and Filed. Motion to Adjourn

Defendant Michael P Stith not in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Gerald Lebell in court for Michael P Stith.  Defendant's appearance waived. Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr for Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense has not received offer and requested adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; VIA ZOOM. Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael P Stith in court by video with Attorney Robert Gerald Lebell who appears in person.  Defendant Michael P Stith in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
All previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect.

Attorney Robert Gerald Lebell in court, defendant Michael P Stith not in court, in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail/bond hearing.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Case remains calendared for a status conference on August 3, 2022 at 8:30 AM in Preliminary Court.  Case adjourned to Branch PE.

Attorney Robert Gerald Lebell in court, defendant Michael P Stith not in court, in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defense is in another county on another matter; unable to submit a waiver at this time. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Defense would like to be heard on bail.  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 057957,
Payable Number: 1015307,
Receipt Number: 22RP025504,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Michael P Stith not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness was present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael P Stith not in court, defendant in custody.  Greg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to remain in custody until a device becomes available.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael P Stith in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Michael P Stith in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael P Stith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
